trial_identification.studytitle: Serum levels range of myocardial enzymes following urologic procedures.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The impact of urologic surgical procedures on the serum levels of myocardial enzymes: CPK, CK-MB, SGOT and LDH.
trial_identification.trialacronym: MESLeCUS (Myocardial Enzymes Serum Levels Changes in Urological Surgery)

interventions.interventions: Measurement of the range of CPK, CK-MB, LDH and SGOT serum levels following urologic surgical procedures. The serum levels of these enzymes are going to be measured 24 hours pre- and 24 and 72 hours post-operatively.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To determine the changes in the levels of CPK (creatine phosphokinase), LDH (lactate dehydrogenase), SGOT (aspartate transaminase) enzymes and CK-MB (creatine phosphokinase MB) isoenzyme in healthy patients who undergo urologic surgery.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: The serum activities of CPK, CK-MB, LDH and SGOT are going to be measured preoperatively (the day before surgery) and postoperatively (the first and the third postoperative day).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: To compare the change of these enzymes in separated categories of procedures (open, endoscopic and laparoscopic)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: The serum activities of CPK, CK-MB, LDH and SGOT are going to be measured preoperatively (the day before surgery) and postoperatively (the first and the third postoperative day).

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Patients with no medical history of myocardial disease who undergo urologic surgical procedures, including open, endoscopic and laparoscopic surgery. 2. Age over 18 years old.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. History of coronary disease. 2. Evidence of acute myocardial infarction (AMI), diagnosed by clinical, laboratory (normal troponin levels) and electrocardiographical findings.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Elevation of serum levels of myocardial enzymes is considered to be a specific finding for acute myocardial infarction (AMI). However, many other conditions have been proposed to affect the level of these enzymes. This study was designed to determine the changes in the levels of LDH, SGOT, CPK and CK-MB in patients who undergo urological surgery with no medical history of myocardial disease.
